Hemophilia. It could be so mild you'll just bleed for a little longer than an unaffected person would (missing about ~5% of either clotting factor) or so severe you could bleed to death from taking a door frame to the face (missing about 90% or more clotting factor) or it could be somewhere in between and you could start to bleed out in surgery from a condition you didn't realize you had until substantial trauma was obtained (surgical incisions).

WRITING.TITLE: Help with coping with guilt and shame after sexual assault?
WRITING.TEXT:
It's been almost a year and a half since I was violated and I just have no idea what to do. I can't handle it. I cry all the time, I have flashbacks, I can't handle being near other women (I've scared of them since the assault, and it's a pain because I'm a woman myself so everyone assumes I'll be more comfortable with them), it destroyed my relationship because I kept bothering my boyfriend with it and he left, I can't go to school because of it, I have no self esteem, I hate my body, it's not even *my* body, I can't handle sitting without my arms crossed over my chest, I cry every time I have to change my clothes or shower, I can't see doctors anymore, and I just want to feel better but it feels like I never will. I feel like it's my fault it happened because I didn't protect myself and I feel so much pain living in this body that's been made impure and dirty.
Is there anything I do to feel better? Please help me.

There's also people out there who take advantage of drunk guys, and those rapists are despicable too.
But yeah, I do think if you're both drunk it cancels it out. It would either have to be that you both raped each other or neither of you raped the other.
It doesn't matter to them "even half-way-gay is an abomination to God", quoth my family. They actually tend to speak even meow poorly of bisexuals because they're the type who think bi means slutty.

I know things aren't that bad, relatively (we aren't a war-torn, fascist nation full of segregation, discrimination and we are free of many other bad things as well) but I feel it is overall not a country to be admired, but every country has its flaws.
I live in a family of conservatives so I'm worried they found out I'm bisexual.
Right, humble is the same thing as miserable and degraded and insecure and mocked by their peers /s

I am not 12, nor have I ever even heard of Noam Chomsky. I've collected those facts from experience and the experiences of others.
You don't think it's a major issue that people can't receive the medical care they need? You don't think it's an issue that countless people lose their lives to mass shooting at educational facilities regularly, that that's become a common place thing? Or that there are people advice against other's rights just because some things are against their own personal religious beliefs? That our education system is primarily busy-work and impractical skills that won't prepare youth for the world in anyway?
You think *not* being emotionally abusive and humiliating and degrading your child is a mistake?

Spanking has always seemed so creepy to me. It seems sexual and no one should be touching their child in a sexual way, ever. Like, if somebody slaps my ass at school or in a club or whatever I can cry sexual harassment and people will sympathize with me and feel bad for me and be all "Omg what a creep", but if I express how wrong I think it is that my *parents* slapped my ass when I was young they're all "Oh, you'll understand when you're a parent", "It was for you're own good", "You should thank them". It's disgusting.
I'm glad you got to have that taken care of. It's not fair to anyone, neither the parent nor the child, for an unwanted baby to be had.

American here- America does in fact suck. People die because they can't afford health care, there's a school shooting every other week, the education system is laughably impractical and ineffective, we have one of the highest numbers of prisoners compared to our general population, many people, even politics, can't seem to separate religion from state, we cannot agree on anything, more than 1 in 3 people are obese here while 1 in 7 starves, there is so much wrong with this country.

I think rational anti-rape stuff is very important to be spoken though, and this doesn't seem like it's irrational SJW propaganda- it's just some badasses standing up to some dipshits. People need to keep speaking out against sexual violence, sexism (both misogyny and misandry), domestic abuse (by and against both genders), etc.

So what does he think about the violent taking of men when done off public grounds? Does he not realize that that would mean somebody could just walk into his own house and rape him with no repercussions? I mean I realize he's obviously very unintelligent because he believes that one's gender could make them inferior (there is literally no logic in any sexism, misogyny or misandry) but does he not even realize that that ridiculous idea wouldn't "teach women to lock their doors and be careful who they go home with" but that it would open men up to being raped in their own homes too? Or is he so stupid he thinks only women can get raped and rape can only be done by men?
I just don't understand his line of thinking of at all.

I have met people who literally think women are not capable of hurting people because of their "nurturing instincts". One told me it is a biological fact that women can't hurt people, because those indicts won't let them.
And I realize men have had it good historically, but that doesn't mean women don't hurt people very frequently.

I'm a woman. I asked this question because I want to know why my culture is so close-minded that I can't get the justice I deserve for having been sexually assaulted by another woman. Thank you for the dose of misandry thoigh(:
And how fascinating that you know *literally every person an on the planet* and therefore are able to state the beliefs of *every single one of them*. However, I hate to disagree with you, oh omnipotent wise one, but I have met people do *do* believe that woman cannot and do not hurt people.

I know you're not trying to poke fun at me, and even if you were, I am a woman so I wouldn't take offense in an implication that I'm not manly.
And I wonder why those paranoid women aren't worried about the other women. If they're going to assume that the vast majority of random men are going to molest their kids, you'd hunk they'd want to be thorough and watch out for any women who might want to do the same.

Maybe I just know shitty people then, as I've had multiple people tell me that I must be delusional to think a woman molested me.
And what about little things like how parents get suspicious of men out with a young child, but don't bat an eye at a woman out with a young child?

I feel like it's not misogyny, because it's a privilege. It helps women get away with abusing their spouse or molesting a child. That's not maltreatment of women, it's placing them up on a pedestal. If a woman slaps her husband in public, people laugh. If a man slaps his wife in public he gets his ass kicked.
But if it's that they just think women are too weak to abuse men, then why do they deny women can abuse other women or children?

The statistics not accurate though. Like for example, in the UK, females account for less than one percent of incarcerated sex offenders, whereas information gathered form the anonymous helpline for abused children, 1 in 6 account that their abuser is a woman.
No one should be dismissed just because statistically it's less common. All ignoring these issues does is make it easier for females to get away with it and harder for victims to get help.
But how did our culture become this way? How does a culture collectively decide to ignore and coddle violent females and force their victims into silence?

But that doesn't mean female-perpetrated cookie never happens. I don't think it's right to ignore any victim just because they were hurt by a woman, or to ignore female abusers just because they're female.

I feel like it's only more present statistically because of all of the doubt victims face if they speak out against a woman.
And this question was sparked because I just wonder how so many people can just ignore that women hurt people while being all abuzz with the violence men commit. Like how rape is an issue so in the spotlight right now but only male praises are ever mentioned.

I'm always hearing all of this stuff about how women *never* commit violent acts, how they are nurturers and protectors and would never hurt anyone. I have had people laugh in my face when I tell them I was molested by another woman. I have been told I must just be a lesbian in denial because a woman would *never* force herself on someone. I have heard male victims of domestic violence be silenced or insulted just because it's a woman who hurts them. I've see people be treated like shit just because the person who harmed them wasn't a man. Why does this happen?

WRITING.TITLE: [Serious] How come no one ever talks about female-perpetrated violence and instead acts like women never hurt people?

WRITING.TEXT:
Ok, I have an honest question. How can a man support a group of people who do things like protest the building of men's shelters, advocate the myth that all sexual crimes are done by men to women, protest paternal rights, and then do little things like drink from mugs that say "male tears" knowing damn well if you drank from a mug saying "female tears" they'd call you a misogynist pig rapist? Or that they'd call you a misogynist pig rapist if you even speak to them in a tone they don't like or if you sit with you're knees apart on a bus?
I'm a woman and I can't even get behind them because of how misandrist they are.
Feminist was such a good thing when it started out, when women actually *were* oppressed (I'm talking about in first-world countries, I know there are oppressed women, but it's not the ones here in America crying about "man-spreading" and "rape culture" and complaint about it online are *not* helping the child brides and women who get beaten if they leave the house without a man) but now it's just a hypocrites movement that has become what it was made to stop- it is hate movement full of sexism.

I think it's also messed up that they only act like all *men* are creeps. It's like they don't realize women can and do molest children too. If they really are going to be *that* paranoid they may as well be thorough and accurate. Imagine how stupid they'd feel if they spent so much time being hostile and rude to men to try to protect their kids only to fail to protect them from sick fucked up woman.

But "You'll change your mind, you're just too young and one you meet the right person you'll want to have babies with them. It doesn't matter if you don't *think* you like kids now, you will once it's your own. It doesn't matter if you have some sort of genetic trait you don't want to pass on to a child that would be forced to suffer because of it or if you can't afford a child or especially if you just don't want to. There is never ever ever and excuse to live your life anyway other than *exactly how I say you should*. Don't be selfish. Besides, who will take care of you when you're old? And don't you want to be loved? And what about your parents? What if they thought like you? They deserve grandchildren."
I don't know why people get so angry and condescending and rude when someone says they don't want kids. It's my body, I am the only one who gets to decide if I want to use it to harvest children or not. Spoiler alert- I do not and no one's close-minded opinions can change that. Do they really think being so unaccepting and judgmental will change our minds?

Having an eating disorder. It is not at all like it is portrayed in the media. It is not being afraid of chocolate and ice cream and eating only 1/4 cup of salad and nuts every 3 days.
It's not always a desperate fight with yourself. It's always not sad. It's not always full of anger. Its different for everyone who experiences it. And to some...*It's fun*.
Yep.
It feels so fucking amazing to get to eat 4000 calories of whatever the fuck you want and purge it all away and be losing several pounds a month.
It feels amazing to wake up from a fast, dizzy and floaty and high.
It feels amazing to be constantly receiving compliments and stares and such.
It feels amazing to feel so superior and perfect and so much better than everyone else.
Sometime it's just counting calories of whatever food you like, eating anything but within moderation.
Sometimes it's a hobby.
Sometimes it *is* just about losing weight. It's not always caused a trauma or a need for control or perfectionism. Sometimes it's just a quick way to drop a ton of weight.
Oh, and sometimes it is a choice. Sure as hell was for me.
And the bitch of it is...*recovery* is the part that sucks. Recovery is not happy and hopeful and it doesn't feel like taking your life back. It feels like losing everything you worked so hard to achieve, the destruction of an important part of your identit you, the lose of a friend. Getting better is what makes it hard. Having an eating disorder is amazing. Being forced to recover is traumatic.
Yeah, if people expect action to be taken then there needs to be proof.

In a court of law, absolutely there needs to be proof. But I feel like if you're just telling someone because you need to talk about it and need support *then* it's rude to ask for proof. Like if a friend tried to confide in you that they were violated and you ask them to prove it you're an asshole, but in court, that's the only way to go: proof and evidence.
They (judges and juries and such) can't just blindly believe the victim- that's not fair. People are at times accused of rapes they didn't commit, rapes that didn't even happen, and those people should not suffer just because of an unrealistic ideal of always being believed.
Innocent until proven guilty exists for a reason.
Don't you know men can't get raped? It's a tool of the PaTrIaChY /s

Well, I'm petite and stay that way by walking for 30 minutes a day and doing 3 minutes of planks, a 1 minute wall-sit, and 100 squats every other day as well as eating about 1,700 calories a day. I do not only eat salad and snack on veggies all day. I eat whatever I want. It's not what you eat...it's how much.

*What* you eat only affects your health, it's how *much* you eat that affects your weight. I am a size zero at 5'1 and 95 pounds and I eat junk food everyday. I just eat it in numbers that fit into my calorie limit. Today I've had pizza, sugar cookies *and* oreos, lollipops, and chocolate milk. Is that healthy? No. Does it mean I'll get fat? Also no. I love junk food so I eat it in moderation and take vitamins to compensate a bit. Y
ou can be thin and eat *literally whatever you want*...you just have to eat it in reasonable amounts.

Red- Ignisionis- (ig-nis-ee--nis) From the Latin words ignis (fire) and passionis (passion)
Orange- Vivalum (viv-uh-lum) from vivum (lively) and benevolum (welcoming)
Yellow- Laetecra (LAY-tuh-cruh) from ludicra (playful) and laeta (happy)
Green- Silvrram (silv-RAM) from silva (forest) and terram (ground)
Blue- Vitaessentia (vitt-eh-SENT-ee-uh) from vitae essentia (life essence)
Purple- Malumare (ml-uh-mar-ee) from malum (mischief) and amare (love)
Pink- Curaescentia (cure-uh-sent-ee-uh) from curae (care) and adolescentia (youth)
Black- Aeternox (ay-tur-noks or ee-tur-noks) from aeternae (eternal) and nox (night)
Brown- Terreniverum (TARE-eh-nee-VARE-um) from terreni (earthy) and pulverem (dust)

I considered actually answering truthfully, telling her that I actually had been molested, just for the shock value and so maybe she'd feel bad about it and not bother me about children anymore but it's not something I like to admit in person. I'm not sure if in her mind that would make my choice acceptable. Maybe it would just affirm her apparent idea that not wanting kids = broken. One reason I can think of as to why molestation would make somebody not want kids would be because of the fact that you would would have to spend several hours, maybe even days (sole labors last like 48 hours right?) with your legs spread wide open as doctors and nurses look at you in ways that may be reminiscent of the trauma. And it would make receiving prenatal care stressful.

I think the only way it might effect my choice is that I know if the child were female I wouldn't be able to bond with it. I think if I really wanted to have kids I could work around the trauma...see a male OBGYN for the prenatal stuff, do a home-birth to avoid the fear I would feel if I ended up being handled by female nurses in a hospital, and I could give the child the good early life I didn't get. I could experience childhood as it should be from a second-person perspective, but I don't think that would be worth it. I have so many reasons to not want to.
That's why I think it's not a factor. I think I could get around the problems that would arise because of it (except the part about how if it was a daughter I'd never have any sort of bond with it, but I just now thought of that).
And I'd already decided I didn't want kids before the really bad event occurred, that one that really upsets me.
And it doesn't seem like you're raining on my parade, just discussing and making observations(:

WRITING.TITLE: My face is ruined.
WRITING.TEXT:
I love crooked teeth. Crooked teeth are cute and sexy and natural and fun. I have *no* interest or admiration of manufactured pack-mentality perfection. This is why I am so resentful over being forced into braces at the age of 12 and made to stay in them for the 3 years that followed, and now at 16 I *thought* everything would be ok- I could just not wear my retainers and they would drift back to cuteness. I am now ugly forever. My face looks plain and unremarkable. The very worst part is that I can't even just not wear my retainer because the orthodontist *permanently glued* a metal wire to the back of my front teeth to make sure they can't move. It is painful and uncomfortable and I have to hold my mouth in an uncomfortable way to keep my tongue from being made to bleed by it. Even more frustrating is I cannot drive due to an anxiety disorder and vision problems, and because I live in a very back-woods, small town...we have *no* public transportation, so I can't get a job and work for the money needed to have the wire removed. But *I* shouldn't even be the one to have to pay for it. It should be the responsibility of the people who forced me to get an unwanted, unnecessary cosmetic procedure that only made me ugly. I will never be cute again. I will always be in physical pain. I am always so on edge because of non-relate issues and this just pushes me even farther. I am in so much distress over this and no one even cares, it doesn't matter that I'm uncomfortable and unhappy with it because "*ohhhhh but literally everyone needs to look exactly the same!! Why would you ever want a unique smile!?*"
Well guess what? I don't smile anymore. I am too ashamed of what my teeth look like now and in too much discomfort.

WRITING.TITLE: "We're you molested as a child!?!"
WRITING.TEXT:
I am so fucking *infuriated* by the thought process of some people when they find out I don't want kids. Some of the things they say and the conclusions they come to are just ridiculous and hurtful and straight-up stupid. Why can't they just accept that not everyone wants the same things as them? There is not tragic reason as to why...I just don't.
I hate how many conversations go like this-
Judgy Condescending Close-Minded Individual with a Superiority Complex- "Ohhh Angel, what are you going to name your kids?"
Me- "I'm not going to have any"
JCCMIWASC- "OH MY GOD ARE YOU INFIRTLE!?!"
Me- "No."
JCCMIWASC- "Then what's *wrong* with you?" *horrified expression*
Nothing. I just hate babies and children. They are gross and they take all your time and they decimate your life. All you can be is a parent then. And, oh yeah, *I just don't want to*.
Super-Conservative- "What!?! Why don't you want to hold Snexfleighke??"
Me- "I don't want her to throw up on me or drool on me or touch me or really be near me at all..."
SC- *smug smirk* "Well what are you going to do when you have your own kids?"
Me- "I'm not."
SC- "But don't you want to get married? You'll be alone forever. No man will want to marry a woman who doesn't like kids."
Why would I want to marry someone who would only want me for the purpose of pushing out babies? Maybe I would prefer a husband or wife who would want me because they enjoy spending time with me and care for the person I am, not just for a person who has a fertile body and the ability to reproduce?
And the icing on the offensive and inconsiderate cake:
Baby Crazy Mombie- "The greatest joy of being a woman is motherhood"
Me- "I don't want children. There are so many other joys in life."
BCM- "Why don't you want children!? Were you molested or something!?"
Yes actually, I was, but that has no bearing on whether or not I want to reproduce- and spoiler alert...I DON'T. Thanks for reminding me though, and I do so appreciate the implication that I *must* be *damaged* to come to such a sad and selfish choice to not reproduce /s
Why do these people think that there has to be something wrong to cause somebody to not want children? Why do they think those who are childfree will be lonely? Why do they assume that the only reason someone could *possobly* have to not reproduce must be a trauma?
It is just a lifestyle choice. There is no reason more than that I do not want to.
Yeah, there is a lot more logic involved in pro-ana
